sequence:
Avrora and Her Jovial Friends

<size=45>Chapter 4: Old Soldiers</size>

scripts.say: One day, at port...
Unfolding before me was the strangest tea ceremony(?) I had ever witnessed in my life.
Hehh~ So this is the Sakura Empire's famous matcha~
Hahah! Wouldn't mind having some of this stuff every now and then!
Mikasa, thank you for bringing us all these souvenirs from the Sakura Empire.
Ahaha! No need to be reserved, my comrades! We've all lived through the same era together!
How strange... I don't seem to see anyone here who fits that description! There aren't any girls here with super long service histories~
Come to think of it, you're right. Hehe~
Hey Avrora, the video game that Commander bought looked super fun, right? Why don't we all give it a try next time?
Video games? I'm no good at those...
Ehh? Mikasa, you're not a gamer~?
I-is there any particular reason for me to become a "gamer?"
Well, we're all allowed to have our own hobbies. Besides, Kuku, wouldn't it be better if you had other interests outside of playing games?
Suuure, whatever you say~
Hahaha, it's good to see that neither of you have changed.
Hmm... Seems like I'm the only person here whose memories are a rather hazy... though it's not like I don't remember anything at all.
What are you saying, Gangut? Regardless of the length of time, we've always been working together towards the same goals.

The sudden emergence of powerful enemies from the depths that seized the seas from us and resulted in countless sacrifices... the despair that came from the overwhelming difference in power between us...
And, the friends from all over the world who set aside their differences and banded together to desperately fight to protect our azure lanes...
Mm... and while the times may have changed, comrades from all different factions once again gather at the same port to sail under the same banner, just like back then...
Yes, and it's all thanks to Commander's hard work.
Even though we are older, we can still use our powers to guide our juniors on the right path.
Ahh, but it's still too soon to retire. Hahaha!
And thus, the conversation of the venerable veterans continued.
